column1: Schönebeck was a district (Kreis) in the middle of Saxony-Anhalt
column2: Germany. Neighboring districts are (from north clockwise) the district-free city Magdeburg

column1: The district was created on July 1
column4: and was therefore named Landkreis Calbe. 1946 Schönebeck became a district-free city
column5: but was reincorporated into the district in 1950 and became the new administrative seat. It was also renamed to Landkreis Schönebeck then to represent the change of capital.

column1: Main rivers in the district are the Elbe and the Saale. The landscape is the mostly flat Magdeburger Börde. The elevation of the district ranges between 43 m and 123 m above sea level.
In 1991 the district started a friendship with the Polish district Jarosław
column2: which was converted into a partnership in 2001. Another friendship with the district Wittmund in Lower Saxony.
